dataList.title: Dai un'occhiata in giro per la fabbrica.
successDesc:
Dopo aver riflettuto ed aver dato un'occhiata in giro, {0} nota che la macchina della fabbrica sta operando ad alta velocità.

{0} dice che due ore di sonno potrebbero essere un peso per gli altri operai...

e potrebbe anche avere anche delle conseguenze sulle linee di produzione.

"Hai un'occhio attento per i problemi."

"Hai sentito? Basta fare storie e torna a lavoro."

Il proprietario dà un'occhiataccia all'operaio, che stava scendendo lentamente le scale, prima di offrirci qualcosa.

"Volevo darlo come bonus per lavorazione buona ad un mio dipendende, ma immagino di non doverlo più fare adesso. Ecco qui, prendete."
failureDesc:
{0} esprime perplessità su come nessuno, compreso l'operaio stesso, sembra notare che quest'ultimo abbia dormito per due ore intere. 

"Tsk tsk. L'immagine dell'azienda ne risentirà."

"Sei licenziato. Vattene."

Qualcosa non quadra, ma ormai è troppo tardi.

L'operaio si inginocchia lentamente, con le lacrime agli occhi, ma il proprietario non batte ciglio e va via dalla stanza.

Siamo rimasti soli, assieme al suono del pianto lento e disperato dell'operario.

dataList.title: Osserva più da vicino il proprietario e il dipendente.
successDesc:
{0} paced between the two of them for a while, before coming to a realization that the lengths of their days were completely different.

In the eyes of the factory owner, who lives eighty-hour days, it may have looked as though the employee slept for two straight hours.

But for the employee, who only lives six-hour days, it must have been a mere nine-minute nap. {0} relays this information.

"Hm. How many hours do you work in a day?"

"F...i...v...e... H...o...u...r...s..."

"Hm, yes. That sounds about right. I'll let this one slide, but be careful not to make the same mistake twice."

With that, the owner walked past the employee.

The employee very slowly bowed at us in gratitude before leaving something in our hands.
failureDesc:
{0} expressed that the employee lives shorter days than the owner.

"And why would that be any of my business?"

"Nine minutes, two hours, it makes no difference. You still decided to sleep in the middle of a workday. You're fired."

Something was wrong—but it was too late.

The employee very slowly fell to their knees, tears welling in their eyes, but the factory owner did not even bat an eye before turning around and leaving the room.

We were left alone with the employee's slow, excruciating wailing.

successDesc:
{0} claims that there is something wrong with their calculation.

The other Sinners chime in to say that they should probably get that amount verified. One of them notes that, conveniently, there is a Collections Office nearby.

The whispering crowd begins to grow around the commotion, and the Time Collector eventually gives in.

"Looks like you're not carrying a timepiece."

"I would stay out of trouble if I were you."

Clearly annoyed by the obstruction, the Time Collector grumbled about something and left; but not before taping something to the Sinner's clothes.

successDesc:
After barely managing to catch up to the youth, {0} asks them what's gotten them in such a hurry.

The youth keeps glancing at his watch, clearly impatient about even waiting for {0}'s question to finish. He keeps pacing from one location to another.

"I have to work fast so I can make more time!"

"That factory owner there? I'm sure he's got ten more hours in his life than I do!"

{0} leans in and asks the youth: "what are you going to use all that time for?"

"With more time, I can use that time to work longer hours! Agh, I'm late! Gotta run, bye!"

The youth hurriedly runs into the building.

We never did find out what he really wanted to do with all that time.

Looks like he dropped something in his hurry...

But he's already too far gone to give it back.
failureDesc:
You couldn't catch up to the youth.

Oh well.

successDesc:
You ask the old man: "How can you smile like that when it's clear that you have such little time?"

The old man smiles gently before writing something down on a paper.

'Life is not a matter of how much time we have.'

'What truly matters is how we use the time that is given to us.'

'How can I make any other face but a smile when, at this moment, I am afforded leisure in such a hurrying world?'

The old man slowly turns around and walks away.

Looks like he left something behind.

You look up to return the item to the old man... but he's already gone.
failureDesc:
You ask the old man: "How can you smile like that when it's clear that you have such little time?"

The old man smiles gently before writing something down on a paper.

We don't have time for this nonsense.

You hurry on your path, leaving the old man behind.

successDesc:
UNITE!

The Yurodivy produces a few bottles of liquor stolen from the rich and pours it over the pile of chalices, all the while shouting the chant.

Alcohol overflows the uppermost chalice and spills, filling the other chalices below.
failureDesc:
That was a very awkward chant. Everyone suddenly shoots a suspicious look in your direction.

You make some bad excuses about having places to be before quickly booking it from the hideout.

successDesc:

They can't move, and you can't physically touch them.

But you find a suspicious looking receipt from under the victim's foot.

This might be a clue.
